4* Distributions In view of the growing problem of the aged in foreign lands, and
the extent to which these lands have looked particularly to England for guidance
in solving this problem, it is believed that a significant foreign use would be
possible for this series if a straightforward approach is used, and "tricky11
production is avoided. This secondary use should be kept in mind in the selec¬
tion of personal, social, economic and industrial examples for the series. Uni¬
versality should be emphasized in all planning and writing. Foreign experts,
serving as consultants, checking scripts in advance, will help insure wise plan¬
ning in this regard.
Finally, it is our hope and belief that all or part of these programs might
also be made into television kinescopes or films for the last step in the full
use which should be visualized for this project.
